name: Chase National Bank, Appellant, v. Krouse

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaefer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Chase National Bank, Appellant, v. Krouse.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
This is not such a clear case as to warrant a judgment for want of a sufficient affidavit of defense. The lower court refused judgment, from which order plaintiff appealed. The dismissal of the rule is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Egan.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Carl E. Glock, with him Thomas W. Pomeroy, Jr., and Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, for appellant.
casebody.head_matter:
Chase National Bank, Appellant, v. Krouse.
Argued October 8, 1934.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaefer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
Carl E. Glock, with him Thomas W. Pomeroy, Jr., and Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, for appellant.
Howard D. Montgomery, for appellee.
November 26, 1934:
